page.title: 01MAGULL AND MELLING
page.content: This twelve square kilometre block takes in the sourthern part of Maghull, the village of Melling and parts of Aintree and Waddicar which border the northern outskirts of Liverpool.l The ancient church sites of Maghull and Melling both occupy sandstone outcrops standing out from the clay plains below. The towns are still independant and thriving set amongs farmlands of the Lancashire plain. The area is well connected by road, motorway, railway and canal. A population of about 25,000 ensures a good supply of shopping, schools, recreational facilities, churches, libraries and a variety of housing. The good farmland about is mainly used for growing grass crops but about 40% is devoted to vegetable crops. The Leeds,Liverpool canal passes through.
